q:
How many bytes of memory does the below C programme allocate for pointer "A"  and "B" respectively?

#include<stdio.h>
#include<stdlib.h>
int main()
   {
       int *B;
       int *A;
       A = (int*)malloc(sizeof(int)*4);
       A = realloc(A,sizeof(int)*4);
       B = (int*)malloc(sizeof(int)*4);
       B = realloc(B,sizeof(int)*2);
       return 0;
   }

What will be the output of the following C code?

C code

 #include<stdio.h>
   #include<stdlib.h>
 
   int main()
   {
       int *pointer;
       int var;
       pointer = (int *)malloc(sizeof(int)*10);
       free(pointer);
       return 0;
   }

What will be the output of the following C code?

C code

# include<stdio.h>
# include<stdlib.h>
  
void solve(int *a)
{
    a = (int*)malloc(sizeof(int));
}
  
int main()
{
    int *a;
    solve(a);
    *a = 12;
    printf("%dn",*a);
    return(0);
}

What will be the output of the following C code?

C code

#include<stdio.h>
   #include<stdlib.h>
 
   int main()
   {
       int *Apointer, *Bpointer;
       Bpointer = malloc(8);
       *Bpointer = 6;
       *Apointer = free(Bpointer);
       printf("%d\n",*Apointer);
       return 0;
   }

a.option: It will print the address stored in Apointer.
